item.title: The EU's groundbreaking Directive 2024/1385 on Violence Against Women is a significant step forward in promoting gender equality.
item.description:
Dr. Ceren KasÄ±m, Postdoctoral Research and Teaching Fellow, University of Hildesheim, Germany Photo credit: MesserWoland, via Wikimedia Commons INTRODUCTION May 14, 2024, marked a pivotal moment for the European Union (EU) as it unveiled its first legally binding instrument to combat violence against women and domestic violence. This Directive, officially known as Directive 2024/1385, signifies the EU’s strong commitment to achieving genuine equality for women. Gender-based violence is a pervasive issue across the EU...
